data.title: MUST VISIT!
data.text: So cute!  This is the little ice cream parlor referred to in the Family Circus comics.  Traditional 1950's icecream parlor down to the pink seats and fountain counter.  Delicious place to stop for an end of night treat.  The kids loved it.

data.title: See your dentist for consotation
data.text: While if you traveling through Scottsdale and particularly Old Scottsdale, go the Sugar Bowl.  Why you ask, do yo remember the old soda fountain growing as a kid?  Your Mom or Dad thought you were especially good in cleaning up your room, taking the trash out when not asked, or washing the dog if it didn't need or not.  You got rewarded and you could use it anyway you wanted.  Sugar Bowl is the place to go. Yummy sundaes, mouth watering soda, delicious shakes, and the entrees are dreamy.  So when you go, just remember brain freezes from sucking down your shake too quickly and have a check up with the dentist as well.  It will be worth it.  :+)

data.title: Sweet Experience
data.text: This restaurant caught our eye because it had a variety of clientele, including families, so if wanting to avoid the more rowdy eateries, I'd recommend this.  The service was excellent, I even heard someone on another table ask our waitress if she was always so nice. We ordered toasted cheese sandwiches and ice cream sundaes - of which there is an excellent range.  The portion sizes were moderate, which suited us.  Some other diners were shocked by larger portions but I think the menu makes it clear what to expect. There was a friendly, relaxed atmosphere, aided much by the servers.

data.title: Great Ice Cream
data.text: Went here with a friend on a whim and we were both so glad that we did! Service was decent, enjoyed the ambiance, the ice cream was great and you can't beat the location!

data.title: Yes, Yes---so good!
data.text: I had the top hat sundae.  A cream puff with vanilla ice cream and hot fudge.  So amazing.  I was with a group of 6 and everyone enjoyed their dessert.  Great place, highly recommend!

data.title: Great restaurant, excellent salads and shakes
data.text: Love this place, we visited 4 times and each time we received great service, very friendly and efficient, and great food.  It's perfect for any time of the day, very clean, and has a lovely, old-fashioned feel about the place.  You can tell it's not a chain just by the atmosphere.  Would highly recommend.

data.title: Perfect ice cream classic
data.text: This is an old-fashioned, classic ice cream parlor, complete with pink and white striped chairs. Walk in, and you are transported back to another era. The mint chip is among my favorite flavors here, as is the black cherry. Don't miss this one when you are in Old Town!

data.title: Good malts
data.text: Great atmosphere and friendly staff. Grilled cheese is simple but a classic. They do not have French fries but do offer decent chips on the side. The dessert menu will have options for everyone, I believe the ice cream offerings change through the seasons as well. I mostly stick with the mint chocolate chip malt.

data.title: Awesome interior
data.text: Prices range for ice cream $6-$8 ish, but don't plan on sharing, it's a one person sundae. Brownies were not good, ice cream fair. Shakes we ordered were as thin as water, You're going here for the experience, not good dessert.

data.title: Iconic Ice Cream Parlor from "Family Circus"
data.text:
How often can you visit the location used in a comic?  I didn't realize until we were headed out that this is THE Sugar Bowl from the comic strip, Family Circus.  They even have some autographed comics showing the Sugar Bowl.  
While that might be enough for a visit, this is a complete throwback to the old-style ice cream parlors, with counter service, and one of the best hot fudge sundays I've ever enjoyed.  (They do have a menu with sandwiches, etc., but honestly, I didn't look beyond the hot fudge sunday.) They've been open for years, and I hope they stay open so I can take my grandkids!

data.title: Yum!
data.text: Ice cream parlor straight out of the '50s. You can't make a bad choice from the ice cream menu! Our family tried 5 different ice cream specials from the menu. All were excellent, but we didn't scratch the surface of this menu. Service was great too!

data.title: old time fountain restaurant
data.text: We really enjoyed going to this place on vacation, in fact we went there twice it was so Good!!! The roast beef  sandwich was Great & Ice Cream was top notch. One thing I really like about this place is that They served  large  portions of Ice Cream, you get your money's worth.

data.title: A trip back in time!
data.text: Pink booths, pink Formica tables with matching chairs and ice cream, ice cream, ice cream!! It's nice to be reminded of easier times!!Numerous ways to enjoy ice cream from single scoops to banana splits,malts, ice cream sofas, root beer floats!! Full menu is available but we went for dessert!

data.title: Yup!
data.text:
Stop reading the reviews for this place, and just go.  It's awesome!

Delicious ice cream flavors - and LOTS of them!  The peanut butter cup special (when they have it) is simply baffling how good it is.  With REAL PEANUT BUTTER in it!

Their floats are tasty (I would steer you toward the standard root beer float, it's better than the orange sherbet float).

Service is fast, and their prices are excellent!  Make this a regular stop when you visit Scottsdale and you will thank me!

I also recommend sitting at a table, NOT the bar.  The bar is fun - but the chairs need updating and you will continue to slide off of them the entire time you're sitting there.

data.title: I Scream You Scream
data.text: We all scream for ice cream!  An afternoon stop  that made me so happy!  Step back in time, but the ice cream is timeless. Chocolate shakes and  a very generous scoop of ice cream  refreshed us after an afternoon of sight seeing.  Well, actually I had the raspberry sorbet and it was delish! The decor had been preserved from the fifties and really made the stop special. A nice menu offered all sorts of lunch items including sandwiches, salads, fruit and meat and this goes for dinner too.

data.title: fun with great service
data.text: This cute restaurant/ice cream parlor is located in old town Scottsdale. They have a good sized menu with options for everyone. We ate here and also had ice cream here. The ice cream was very good especially on a hot day. I would recommend this place for anyone who is looking for a place to go. The service was also very good!

data.title: What a fun place!
data.text:
The Sugar Bowl is a landmark of old Scottsdale, and my wife has been there many times growing up. This was the first time we went together and I really enjoyed the atmosphere and the sweets! Had a piece of hot apple pie with ice cream and it was great. 

Sure, its a tourist joint, but it has earned that in the best way possible!

data.title: Good ice cream
data.text: Nice sit down ice cream parlor. Wide selection of treats. The shakes are great as are the floats. The ice cream itself was very good.

data.title: Like the old times
data.text: Beautiful ice cream parlor serving lots of delicious sundaes and food. Really looked like an old time diner, attentive waitress, really enjoyed it.

data.title: I'm sorry to say it's a bit of a tourist trap
data.text: the ice cream quality isn't that great...I forgot the brand they use but it's something you can find in any grocery store..it had a lot of boisterous misbehaved teenagers at the time we were there..
